meanings.definition: Arranged in a pile or heap.
meanings.sent1: The books were stacked neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The cups were stacked on top of each other in the cupboard.
meanings.sent3: She stacked the pillows so high, they almost touched the ceiling!
meanings.sent4: The boxes were stacked like a tower, reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The toys were stacked in a colorful pyramid, ready to be played with.

meanings.definition: Having a lot of something, especially in terms of physical attributes.
meanings.sent1: The bodybuilder was stacked with muscles.
meanings.sent2: The buffet table was stacked with delicious food.
meanings.sent3: The tree was stacked with ripe fruits, tempting all who passed by.
meanings.sent4: The library was stacked with books, offering endless reading options.
meanings.sent5: The warehouse was stacked with boxes, waiting to be shipped out.

meanings.definition: To arrange things in a pile or heap.
meanings.sent1: She stacked the plates after washing them.
meanings.sent2: He stacked the firewood neatly beside the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: The kids stacked the building blocks to create a tall tower.
meanings.sent4: The workers stacked the bricks one by one to build the wall.
meanings.sent5: The chef stacked the pancakes high, ready to be served with syrup.
